content.raw: I seemed simpler to only deal with strings in Python, since there seemed to be several outside functions called which only handled str not bytes. So I thought it was better to have everything as strings in python, ideally converting immediately after the files have been read and before they’re written. In the seq\_array case you mentioned, that conversion back to bytes happens immediately before it is written to an HDF5 file and the new byte string is not used afterwards.
content.html: I seemed simpler to only deal with strings in Python, since there seemed to be several outside functions called which only handled str not bytes. So I thought it was better to have everything as strings in python, ideally converting immediately after the files have been read and before they’re written. In the seq_array case you mentioned, that conversion back to bytes happens immediately before it is written to an HDF5 file and the new byte string is not used afterwards.
